thread.title: Nottingham Forest boss Mark Warburton set to swoop for Gillingham midfielder Josh Wright
thread.title_full: Nottingham Forest boss Mark Warburton set to swoop for Gillingham midfielder Josh Wright

author: dfraser
title: Nottingham Forest boss Mark Warburton set to swoop for Gillingham midfielder Josh Wright
text:
Wright move Nottingham Forest boss Mark Warburton set to swoop for Gillingham midfielder Josh Wright 
Star's form in League One has caught the eye of Forest scouts, who are looking to recruit following Henri Lansbury’s departure Exclusive Comments NOTTINGHAM FOREST are ready to move for Gillingham midfielder Josh Wright. 
Mark Warburton wants the 27-year-old to bolster his squad and is looking to swoop in the summer. Getty Images 3 Josh Wright may be on his way to Mark Warburton’s Nottingham Forest 
Wright’s form in League One this season has caught the eye of Forest scouts, who are looking to recruit following Henri Lansbury’s departure to Aston Villa . 
Keep up to date with ALL the football news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary. 
He is seen as a player who could make the step up to the Championship and could go for just £100,000. 
The Gills risk losing him for nothing at the end of next season when his contract at Priestfield runs out. Rex Features Mark Warburton is looking to add depth after losing Henri Lansbury Getty Images 3 Josh Wright has scored 12 times in 41 games for Gillingham this season 
They could look to cash in on a player who has impressed despite the club battling at the wrong end of the third tier. 
Wright, who played in the Championship with Millwall, has 12 goals this season including a hat-trick of penalties against ex-club Scunthorpe. 
The former Leyton Orient and Charlton man has turned out 41 times in all competitions for Gillingham this term, netting his spot-kick trio earlier this month.
